skill.name: alphafold-database
skill.description: Access AlphaFold's 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, download PDB/mmCIF files, analyze confidence metrics (pLDDT, PAE), for drug discovery and structural biology.
skill.summary: Access AlphaFold's 200M+ AI-predicted protein structures. Retrieve structures by UniProt ID, downloa...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All content consists of markdown documentation and Python example code for accessing public AlphaFold data via legitimate endpoints (alphafold.ebi.ac.uk, Google Cloud, BigQuery). No file system access, no network calls, no code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Access over 200 million AI-predicted protein structures from the AlphaFold database. Download PDB and mmCIF files, analyze pLDDT and PAE confidence metrics for drug discovery and structural biology research.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve protein structure predictions by UniProt ID
Download PDB and mmCIF coordinate files
Parse and work with structures using Biopython
limitations: Requires internet connection for API access
Predictions lack ligands and post-translational modifications

use_cases.title: Download protein structures
use_cases.description: Retrieve and analyze 3D protein structures for structural biology research and validation.

use_cases.title: Analyze binding sites
use_cases.description: Identify druggable pockets and analyze protein conformations for drug target analysis.

use_cases.title: Batch process proteomes
use_cases.description: Download entire proteome datasets and perform large-scale structural comparisons.

prompt_templates.title: Get protein structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the AlphaFold structure for UniProt ID P00520 including pLDDT confidence scores and PAE data.

prompt_templates.title: Download structure files
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the mmCIF and confidence files for protein ABL1 and explain how to parse them.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze confidence
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the pLDDT confidence scores for this protein and identify high and low confidence regions.

prompt_templates.title: Compare domains
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PAE matrix to understand relative domain positions and confidence in the predicted structure.

output_examples.input: Get the AlphaFold structure for protein ABL1 (UniProt: P00520)

best_practices: Cache downloaded structure files locally to avoid repeated API calls
Always check pLDDT scores before interpreting structural features
Use Google Cloud bulk downloads for processing entire proteomes
anti_patterns: Do not use low confidence regions (<50 pLDDT) for structural interpretation
Do not assume predictions include ligands or post-translational modifications
Do not use AlphaFold predictions as a replacement for experimental structures in critical applications

faq.question: Is AlphaFold data free to use?
faq.answer: Yes, AlphaFold DB is freely available under CC-BY-4.0 license. Proper citation is required.

faq.question: What formats are available?
faq.answer: PDB, mmCIF, and binary CIF formats are available. mmCIF is recommended for large structures.

faq.question: Can I use this offline?
faq.answer: You can download structures locally. Initial access requires internet to fetch data from AlphaFold API or Google Cloud.

faq.question: How reliable are the predictions?
faq.answer: High pLDDT regions (>70) are generally reliable. Low confidence regions may be disordered.

faq.question: How does AlphaFold compare to PDB?
faq.answer: PDB contains experimental structures. AlphaFold provides computational predictions for proteins without experimental structures.

faq.question: What are pLDDT and PAE?
faq.answer: pLDDT measures per-residue confidence (0-100). PAE shows confidence in relative domain positions.
